page.title: 14FARM ANIMALS, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
Because of over production in agricul- ture within the European Economic Community, especially milk products, it has been necessary to curb dairy outputs. This has been achieved by the imposition of milk quotas. One or two of the farmers in the area have ceased milk production and changed to cereals and beef with mainly Hereford, Angus and Charolais crosses.
The remaining dairy herds are predomin- antly pedigree Friesian cattle. A few of the farms have sheep as a sideline. Horses are no longer used for farm work and there are only a few kept for riding. In common with the rest of the country this area has tended to move from horn to corn. Farms generally are becoming more specialised.
